title: Ticket #7593: Lots of FDs cause my_popenv_impl() grief
description:
It can take several (approximately four) seconds to close a million FDs. This causes a long cumulative delay in starting up the startd, which makes a few calls to my_popenv, and blocks waiting for the starter (running -classad), which makes quite a few of its own calls to that function.

(It's not clear right now it DaemonCore::Create_Process() has the same problem or not.)

We noticed this because the default ulimit -f is ~1 million in a Docker container we were testing; we should check if that's normal (inherited from the Docker daemon?).

We should commit a quick improvement almost immediately, where we move the call to getdtablesize() out of the loop (cutting the syscall count in half).

See https://gitlab.freedesktop.org/libbsd/libbsd/blob/master/src/closefrom.c for ideas on a better approach.
